reviews.text: One of most popular temple of lord shiva a place where peace and destiny held together

Har Har Mahadev. Very old temple of Lord Shiva situated near river Yamuna

Amazing place.😃😃😃
Har Har Mahadev🙏🙏🙏
All time favourite...peaceful...enchanting aarti
Such a beautiful temple. 😊 (U can really feel his presence)
Great temple... A lot of devotees visit... Very popular
It's a holy place . Not able to describe the feeling when I go there, but it's kind of awesome.
If you believe then why not visit there. A typical hindu temple with lots of calmness.
It is believed that all your wishes are fulfilled after a visit to this place..

this is a very good place one must visit this place it has its own beauty and Glory this place is related to the history of India and gives motivation to the Travellers and tell them about the culture and heritage of India we must be proud on this monument because nothing can come in between we and our patriotism I think the reason behind this monuments is to unite every Indian and see every religion in form of a United body named as India. every Indian must feel proud to have this monument on his land and he or she whatever religion follows, will not opened for the existence of this monument with these words I expect you to visit there and feel every word I have said thank

Nice to see only if you have the time and are already on this side of the river to see Itimad ud Daulah's Tomb or Arambagh. It's down a very small road marked with a faded navy blue sign. Park before the end as turning will be impossible. The glazed tiles are best viewed on the right hand side of the building. There are currently no charges.

There are no facilities available. The cab doesn't go right to the entrance of the monument. There are no amenities for the visitors, no washrooms. Only art and history lovers would go there coz they will have a lot of insights and details to munch on, but generally it's a poor show by the care takers.

It is in dilapidated condition,it was made of blue tiles but almost all of them now gone away from its walls.this tomb is completely neglected by ASI. dome is amazing from inside, beautifully painted.
Take a view of Agra city from the river side.

Visiting Hours:
Chini ka Rauza remains open from sunrise to sunset, all days of the week.

Duration of Visit:
Around 2 hours.

Entrance Fee:
The tourists are allowed free entry to explore the monument anytime.

Famous for:
The pietra dura inlay work with enamel inside the building is almost damaged, yet architecture of the monument attracts most of the tourists. The colorful tiles of chini used in its construction provoke the beauty of the monument

Jama Masjid in Agra is opposite the Agra fort and overlooking the Agra Fort Railway Station. The Jama Masjid is also popularly known as the Jami Masjid or "Friday Mosque". It is one of the largest mosques in India.

Jama Masjid at Agra also known as 'Friday Mosque' is a seventeenth-century structure and is one of the largest mosques built by the Mughals in India. Constructed under the reign of Shah Jahan in 1648, Jama Masjid is dedicated to his favourite daughter Jahan Ara Begum. This splendid monument is visible from the Agra Fort with the Agra Fort Railway station right between the two structures. Jama Masjid has huge significance in the Indian history and culture and has been intricately designed with multi coloured marbles and sandstone.
This place is ivadat place. Muslim people ivadat here. Very beautiful place.
The detailing done on each part of it is divine to watch & u will feel peace inside it
Nice place ... Visited once. Next going  to Bengaluru. Allah Bless me...

The tomb inside is plain, but the building outside is pretty amazing. There's two building. The main gate and the tomb. Both of the building is remarkable. This historical site close to the main road and the parking lot is quite spacious. A bit far from Agra city center, but this place is must to visit while you're in Agra.

MONUMENTAL! The architecture is completely dynastic and has been preserved amazingly. The details and stories behind the details and variations in architecture are remarkable. It's a massive tomb so not all the areas have been kept immaculately however the refurbishments which have been made are definitely  enough to stir the imagination.

Beautiful built tomb. The interiors of the tomb have been plastered over and therefore it looks very plain inside as compared to the outside. The stonework on the entrance inside dome is absolutely stunning. Great detailing work. The gardens are amazing with lots of deer which came as a pleasant surprise.

That place is really so much astonishing not only in the sense of knowing more about the history but also it's beautiful too. We can't capture the beaut of edifice which are there. Provide great source of knowledge to reconstruct the past of Mughal special the political scenario. We can hours here in visiting or exploring it. This place is well in the context to enjoy here with your family, friend, colleagues.

The architecture was just amazing. It was made in such a way that is you speak something inside it, you can hear an echo for already 5 seconds. It has the height of 72 feet. It's made such that it feels cool in summer and warm in winter automatically inside the tomb.
Friendly place and very tasty food with reasonable prices. Fresh juices :) also some western options, no stomach aches ;)
Ate breakfast and dinner here because the food was so delicous. Clean restaurant with great service and fantastic food. 10/10 for the price.

yeah this place is not the biggest but it done it work well enough you know to be honest first I think that it's not work for me but when I go there I find a lot of option for my requirement and so I am satisfied from this the service was good and there were a lot of monster because of the crowd came here and and they do their work....you can come here but I will not let it five star because there is lot of like in the service like they don't you have to wait here a lot you know waiting sometime may be difficult and every gentleman person know this
Great place for breakfast after the Taj Mahal. Got a good tomato and cheese panini like sandwich for 70 rupies, it was really good.
This restaurant's food was very delicious especially Malai Kofta was the best for me. I also ate chomen and maton masala. I recommend you to eat Malai Kofta.

This has got to be my most favourite place throughout my whole journey in India mainly because both Salim and son are just the best, genuine, most humble human beings. Of course the food was amazing too! I don’t usually give 5 stars, but this place deserves it. Thank you so much for your hospitality and and warmth and kindness! 💛

Amazing experience for lunch. We had our first Indian food no spicy. First time in India, that I enjoyed the food very much. The service was so friendly. He asked for my favourite music from my country and he played it. Txarango songs are my favourite and they held a concert in India as well. They also have good coffee and pancakes as dessert. Everything was perfect. Thank you!

Judging by the sheer volume of 5 star reviews along with the ratio of the other star reviews it’s conclusive the vast majority of the reviews are fake. Reading some of them confirms it. Having said that, the food was pretty good, service prompt (the restaurant was empty to be fair) and it was clean. You could do worse.

Had such a nice time! Was relaxing and loved that we had an option to sit inside with AC or outside on their balcony to watch the street. Food was tasty, and staff very friendly and hospitable. If you're ever in this area looking for somewhere to chill or eat I'd pop by if I were you!

Had some good breakfast here. Went back the next day. Chef and the Owner are very friendly and accommodating. Close to where we stayed. Has nice outer terrace and a a/c room. Good place to have coffee and watch street life.
